name: Tim Brown's Playbook: Michigan State vs. Notre Dame - September 19, 1987
description: Brown gets backed up to the opposing 34-yard line before miraculously returning his second punt for a touchdown against rival Michigan State. In 1987, Brown would catch 34 passes for 846 yards, return 34 punts for 401 yards, rush for 144 yards, gain 456 yards on 23 kickoff returns and win the Heisman Trophy. Fans that collect all 4 Playbooks from Tim Brown by August 9, 2021 at 11:59 PM EST will be invited to join a digital meet-and-greet with Tim himself. The collector who purchases the most Tim Brown Playbooks within that same window will receive a signed jersey and helmet from Tim. Full terms and conditions can be found at ftx.us/hof_terms.pdf.
series: Tim Brown's Playbook: Michigan State vs. Notre Dame - September 19, 1987

name: Earl Campbell's Playbook: Texas vs. Houston - November 5th, 1977
description: While sick and battling a fever, Earl Campbell receives the pitch on a quarterback option, and takes it 40 yards for his third touchdown of the game. He would lead the nation in his senior year and become the first University of Texas player to receive the Heisman Trophy. Fans that collect all 4 Playbooks from Earl Campbell by August 9, 2021 at 11:59 PM EST will be invited to join a digital meet-and-greet with Earl himself. series: Earl Campbell's Playbook: Texas vs. Houston - November 5th, 1977

name: Marcus Allen's Playbook: Kansas City Chiefs vs. Detriot Lions - November 29, 1996
description: On Thanksgiving Day, Marcus Allen scores his second touchdown of the day - a one-yard game-winning score. Allen would surpass Walter Payton's rushing touchdowns record (110) with career touchdowns number 111 and 112 recorded in the 28-24 win. name: Earl Campbell's Playbook: Houston Oilers vs. Chicago Bears - November 16, 1980
description: Campbell breaks free for a 42-yard run at the end of the fourth quarter which seals an Oilers victory over the Bears. Campbell would rush for his third 200+ yard game that season and would lead the league with 1,934 rushing yards, earning his third career NFL Offensive Player of the Year award. name: Earl Campbell's Playbook: Rice vs. Texas - October 1st, 1977
description: Earl Campbell finishes a powerful right side run by stiff-arming a would-be tackler 5 yards into the endzone with him. Campbell would go on to lead the nation in rushing with 1,744 yards and 19 touchdowns. name: Doak Walker's Playbook: Texas vs. SMU - November 1, 1947
description: Doak Walker catches a 54-yard pass over the middle to take the ball down to the one-yard line, leading to SMU's game-winning touchdown over Texas. Known as "The Catch to Beat Texas," this play would contribute to Walker’s award-winning college career which included a Heisman Trophy win in 1948 and three-time All American honors. Fans that collect the most Doak Walker Playbooks by August 9, 2021 at 11:59 PM EST will receive a signed book from Doak and two (2) tickets to a special event in 2022. Full terms and conditions can be found at ftx.us/hof_terms.pdf.
series: Doak Walker's Playbook: Texas vs. SMU - November 1, 1947

name: Joe Theismann's Playbook: Washington vs. Miami Dolphins - January 30, 1983
description: In Super Bowl XVII, Joe Theismann takes a snap from his own 18 yard line in what is dubbed his "greatest play." As a result, Theismann keeps the game in reach and would go on to win Super Bowl XVII. That same year, he would be the NFL Offensive Player of the year as well as take home the NFL’s Most Valuable Player award. name: Earl Campbell's Playbook: LA Rams vs Houston Oilers - September 4th, 1978
description: Earl Campbell takes a toss, running through several Rams defenders as they rip him out of his jersey, unable to take him down. The play would earn him the moniker, "The Human Wrecking Ball." That year, Campbell would lead the league with 1,450 yards and earn the NFL Offensive Player of the Year honor. description: Shannon Sharpe catches a 48-yard pass as the Broncos win a tight game that ends with a final score of 20-19. This was Sharpe's first career 100+ yard receiving game, a milestone he would achieve 19 more times. That year, Sharpe would also receive his first of eight Pro Bowl selections. name: Shannon Sharpe's Playbook: Baltimore Ravens vs. Oakland Raiders - January 14, 2001
description: In the AFC Championship Game, Shannon Sharpe scores the only touchdown of the game on a 96-yard slant catch and run. At the time of his retirement, Sharpe was the NFL's all-time leader in receptions (815), receiving yards (10,060) and receiving touchdowns (62) by a tight end. description: Joe Theismann comes in as Washington's punter on 4th and 8 for his first and last punt in the NFL. Theismann would retire later that year with two Super Bowl rings, 160 TDs, 25,206 passing yards, 17 punt returns and one one-yard punt on this play. name: Doak Walker's Playbook: Cleveland Brown vs. Detroit Lions - December 27, 1953
description:
In a tied 1953 NFL Championship Game, Doak Walker kicks the extra point to clinch Detroit's win over Cleveland. It was just 1 of 11 points scored by Doak in the 1953 NFL Championship but it would give him his second NFL Championship and third of five Pro Bowl appearances.

Fans that collect the most Doak Walker Playbooks by August 9, 2021 at 11:59 PM EST will receive a signed book from Doak and two (2) tickets to the 2022 Professional Football Hall of Fame enshrinement ceremony. Full terms and conditions can be found at ftx.us/hof_terms.pdf.
series: Doak Walker's Playbook: Cleveland Brown vs. Detroit Lions - December 27, 1953

name: Shannon Sharpe's Playbook: Denver Broncos vs. Los Angeles Raiders - January 9, 1994
description: Shannon Sharpe catches his 13th pass in the Wild Card Game. Sharpe's 13th catch tied the record for the most pass receptions in a postseason game. name: Tim Brown's Playbook: New York Jets vs. Oakland Raiders - December 2, 2002
description: On 2nd & 16 in the third quarter, Tim Brown catches a 6-yard pass over the middle for his 1,000th career reception. After the monumental 1,000th catch, play was stopped to celebrate Brown's milestone. At the time of his retirement, his 14,934 total receiving yards were the second-highest total in NFL history. description: In the 1952 NFL Championship Game, Doak Walker powered down the field for a 67-yard touchdown run to solidify Detroit’s lead and eventual victory. Doak would score 21 points total in just three NFL Championship Games and retire with 534 career points scored. name: Doak Walker's Playbook: SMU vs. Santa Clara - September 27
description: During a game in the 1947 season, Doak ran back a 96-yard kickoff return which was the longest returned touchdown in SMU history at the time. The play would be the launchpad for Walker as he would go on to win the Maxwell Award and All-American Honors after making his return to football following his military service. name: Hall of Fantasy League
description: The Hall Of Fantasy League (“HOFL”) is the first National Fantasy League that allows its participants to experience a fantasy team with a community of shared Stakeholders. The HOFL is backed by The Hall of Fame Resort & Entertainment Company (NASDAQ: HOFV, HOFVW), the only resort, entertainment and media company centered around the power of professional football. 2021 marks the HOFL’s inaugural season and the 10 league teams are celebrated through the first, exclusive HOFL NFT drop.
series: Hall of Fantasy League
